No: Yes to plan, no to exercises

No: We do not collect PII other than for the purposes of AVIV account creation and access. This user data and all AVIV data can be purged.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does the solution include features to "hide" sensitive data from specific users based on their authorization or profile?

No: Yes, first account is created by Scope3, additional access is granted by AVIV

Are all communications both within the supplier's infrastructure and between the supplier and AVIV encrypted?
Are all encryption or signature certificates generated either by a centralized PKI or a specialized supplier?
Does the supplier implement system hardening best practices or frameworks? If so, which one(s)?
No: Yes, security by design; privacy by design. RBAC, MDM, Secure development policy. We also benefit from the industry leading security controls and features of our primary cloud provider GCP.

No: No, first SOC2 audit targeted for Q1 2025

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: What security measures does your organization have in place for data protection?
No: This is very open ended, please ask a specific question, else see answer to 12.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does your company have a Data Protection Officer?  Provide contact details.
Is your service in compliance with the GDPR?  Is your service in compliance with the CCPA?
Will you be using any personnel outside of the United States to provide Services to Celtra?
No: Yes, We are a global organization and are hiring rapidly. Any list we provide would be out of date within 30 days.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Will you be using any sub-processors to perform services for Celtra?
Are your sub-processors contractually bound to the data protection requirements in place in your contract with Celtra?
Has your company had any data security breaches in the past five years?
Do you have policies and processes in place to ensure that suspected data breaches and security incidents are immediately reported to Celtra?
No: Yes, Starting with procedures, we complete vulnerability scans, have begun annual penetration tests, and generally leverage the security settings, logging, and monitoring provided to us by our cloud platform, GCP. We have appropriate use, cryptographic policies, secure development policies in the final stages of approval that govern our employee behavior. We have also recently begun an engagement with Vanta to help us prepare for a SOC2 audit. We use a robust incident management plan designed to consistently guide our response to incidents at all severitly levels (security or otherwise). In addition, our customer contracts typically contain language that would cover the specifics around the timing of data breaches and security incidents notifications sent to Celtra.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does your organization have any security certifications (ISO 27001, SOC2, etc.)?
No: No, we are recently under contract with Vanta and have begun our SOC2 Type II readiness project.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does your company limit access to Celtra data from non-approved devices?
No: No, Access to Celtra data through the Web UI is available cross device by design. From a backend access perspective, Scope3 access is role based and follows least priviledge. We do not technically limit device connecting to company resources at this time, however BYOD devices (beyond mobile phones accessing M365 and business documentation) are prohibited from accessing company resources by employee policies.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does your company limit access to Celtra data to individuals who need it (Principle of Least Privilege)?
Do you support Google SSO/SAML for customer access?

Name of Vendor Product
Is the system containing Yahoo data running on a cloud service? In the comments, please indicate what service model and/or deployment model is provided.

Does the vendor conduct, or have a third party conduct, a controls assessment/audit on the solution potentially being provided to Yahoo to ensure the product meets industry standards for cloud security?
No: Yes, external penetration test underway, external vulnerability scan, in the process of preparing for SOC2 audit using Vanta.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: If the vendor is providing the ability to set up separate accounts for different Yahoo business units, will there be a client management portal which allows distributed business accounts (business units/departments) to be managed under a single central corporate account?
If Yahoo data will be housed in a resource pooled environment are there controls in place to prevent one client from attempting to compromise another client?
Does the vendor have a data classification and retention policy that identifies data types that require additional security controls and governance?
No: No, we do not have disparate retention policies for customer data. It should be said that we also do not collect or require personal data, PII, or credit card information (using your examples). We have what advertising related data that Yahoo chooses to share with us strictly for the purposes of providing the service.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Will Yahoo data hosted on the vendor system be stored in an encrypted state (encryption at rest)?
Is the encryption algorithm used for encryption at rest compliant with NIST standards?

Does the vendor limit access to the encryption key(s) used on Yahoo data to only those with a specific job function to handle and manage the key(s)?
No: Yes, access is role based and on the concept of least privilidge. we leverage GCP and the tooling provide therein.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Are vendor employees or contractors able to access Yahoo data in an unencrypted state, either while in transit, processing or in storage?
Will Yahoo data be encrypted in transit to or within the vendor's systems?
No: Yes, We leverage Google's storage transfer service between cloud buckets at Google, AWS, Azure, which supports TLS 1.3. See documentation here:  https://cloud.google.com/storage-transfer/docs/overview

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Will the encryption algorithm used for encryption in transit be compliant with NIST standards?
Will the vendor require a direct connection to pull, read, or otherwise directly access networks or data from Yahoo networks?
No: No, Most likely, Yahoo will push data to Scope3, not the other way around. The exact technical means is product and integration specific, Scope3 customers often push data into an AWS bucket, permissions controlled by the customer. Please see our detailed documentation here: https://docs.scope3.com/docs/cloud-bucket-configuration

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Are there documented policies, procedures, and controls to limit access based on need to know or minimum necessary for its employees, agents, contractors (or others as applicable)?
No: Yes, access is role based and on the concept of least privilidge. we leverage GCP and the tooling provide therein.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Are vendor employees and contractors technically prevented from accessing Yahoo data on non vendor-managed devices?
No: No, our vendor managed employees with a role based need to access the data can access it via the same processes and under the same policies as our FTEs

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Is multi-factor (MFA) authentication, including two-factor (2FA), required for employee/contractor remote access?
No: Yes, M365 SSO + Microsoft Authenticator app on Mobile device. In app alert displays a number to be confirmed and user authenicated by either phone unlock pin or biometric verification.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Are employees technically prohibited from accessing production systems remotely (directly from the internet)?
Does the vendor have documented information security program policies which will apply to the protection of Yahoo systems and/or data?
No: Scope3 is a young company and we are in the process of readying our organization for our first SOC2 audit. As such we are in the process of documenting and/or socializing policy, process, and procedures. We have the following policies in place: Change Mangement, Incident Management, Business continuity, Cryptography,Asset Managment + Disposal . We are in the process of finalizing: Secure Development, Data Management, 3rd Party Management.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does the vendor require that all user workstations/devices have up-to-date end-point security?
No: We use sentinel one on our laptops for endpoint security. The devices are managed in an MDM (Rippling MDM for Macs and Intune for PCs) and our policies are enforced using those tools

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Do vendor employees actively maintain firewalls or other network traffic controls (E.g.. Network Access Control Lists, AWS Security Groups) for either internal and external network connections on systems containing Yahoo data?
No: Yes. Scope3 is a fully remote organization and do not have a proprietary network or the concept of priviliged access in any one location. We have no offices elevated access or managed data centers with hardware we manage. We rely fully on our SAAS providers  and their maintenance and upgrade schedules. Inside GCP we rely on role based access control/groups to limit access to those with a specific need (developers).

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Will Yahoo systems or data be exposed to external network connections including connections to or from Yahoo? This includes exposure to the internet.
No: No, please see documentation here for integration specifici detailes. https://docs.scope3.com/docs/getting-started

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Will additional third parties, including third party data centers, have access to Yahoo systems and/or data?
No: Yes, We leverage GCP, and when requested by clients can use Azure or AWS buckets for data transfer. Based on the wording of your Guidance to include 3rd party data centers, said providers have physical access to the physical hardware that hosts the virtualized instances and thus the answer is yes.

Have the supplier's assets undergone a r: Does vendor perform active information security monitoring on the systems that will contain Yahoo data?
No: No, We are a small team and do not have a dedicated NOC or Networking team at this time. We leverage GCP, Google's Security Command Center, Microsoft Defender and rely on industry best practice settings to secure our environments. We log activities and periodically review

No: Yes, external penetration and vulnerability scans are completed annually.

No: Yes, we do manual, Psicurity is the 3rd party security vendor

No: no, but this can be negotiated in contract

No: yes via release notes, customer communications and account teams

No: Yes. Contract engineers are under contract, NDA, confidentiality agreements, and are held to the same standards, policies and processes as FTE employees.
